availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jasper Sorrell (Bath County, Kentucky, farm hand and soldier)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farm hand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Sorrell and Phebe Sorrell. Farm hand in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1860. Mustered in the 24th Regiment Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as corporal on December 31, 1861. Reported as deserted from hospital at Louisville, Kentucky, on January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 20A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 166.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 180-1.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0371.
Find A Grave, "Jasper Sorrell (22 Dec 1839-2 Feb 1910)," Memorial #108631619, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/108631619 (accessed July 17, 2020).
